intro: Galium stojanovii var. abbreviatum, commonly known as the short-stalked bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of western North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
